title: Children placed in emergency accommodation for kids in care are scared, and high-risk children are more likely to get stuck there
content: “Every child I have been with on admission to emergency placements, whether it is foster care or residential, has told me they are scared,” says Claire Brogan, a practice manager with Barnardos.

title: Sixty-six affordable homes in Ballymun are held up amid council reviews
Mortgage boss given injunction against far-right councillor Gavin Pepper over alleged harassment of family
content: The High Court has granted interim injunctions against a far right Dublin City Councillor restraining him from videoing and besetting the home of the boss of mortgage credit servicing and asset management firm Pepper Finance Corporation (Ireland) Ltd DAC.

title: Planning permission for €100m redevelopment of St Stephen’s Green Shopping Centre refused
content: One of Dublin’s most famous landmarks - the Dome at St Stephen’s Green Shopping Centre has been saved - for now.

title: St Stephen’s Green Shopping Centre plan is shot down by planning appeals board
content: An Coimisiún Pleanála said plan would not achieve ‘sufficiently high standard of placemaking, urban design and architecture’

title: Parents face fee rise after Dublin childcare provider pulls out of ‘deeply flawed’ core funding model
content: More centres expected to withdraw from scheme in coming weeks, citing growing costs

title: Homelessness: What does the data tell us about the crisis?
content: On Friday the Department of Housing published the latest of its monthly updates on homelessness. It showed that in June almost 16,000 people, including almost 5,000 children, were relying on emergency State shelter.
